conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with a well, frog, and refractive index.
Description of the well dimensions and refractive index.
Introduction to the concept of total internal reflection.
Explanation of critical angle in optics.
Calculation of the critical angle using arcsin(1/n).
Critical angle calculated as approximately 48.59 degrees.
Light entering at an angle greater than 48.59 degrees will be reflected.
Need to find the maximum vertical distance the frog can see.
Visualization of the well as a cylinder with the frog at the bottom center.
Setup of a right triangle to find the maximum vertical distance.
Introduction of variables r, d, n, and Î¸c.
Consideration of geometry to find the maximum vertical distance h.
Setup of a right triangle with horizontal leg r and vertical leg h.
Consideration of refraction at the water surface.
Application of Snell's law for total internal reflection.
